I recently had my IUD removed, and started to get discouraged after several negative tests. I did a little bit of research, since my doctor never told me what to expect afterwards. It is normal to bleed heavy clumps after it is removed. The IUD works a couple different ways. It does reduce your uterine lining, blocking fertilized eggs from implanting on the uterus, or by creating a mild inflammation which prevents sperm from fertilizing eggs. Some women can get pregnant right after having it removed, but there is a good chance that it wont implant properly, and you will miscarriage. You have a much better chance if you wait a cycle or two, and by your third cycle, your lining should be back to normal. (Not that it hurts to try from day 1!)I read somewhere that several women got pregnant right away, but it wouldn't show up on the pregnancy tests until they were about 3 months pregnant. I asked my doctor about that and she said the IUD didn't have anything to do with the false negatives. Sometimes I feel like maybe they don't really know that much about the IUD, and how it affects a person once it is removed. It does appear to be common to have pregnancy symptoms once it is removed, but I feel (in my case) that it may be due to my lining still too thin, and the pregnancy doesn't last long. Hopefully in another month or so, I'll get my positive sign. =)To all of you out there in "pregnancy limbo", it will happen when it happens, and it's best not to stress about it. Just pay attention to your body signs, and keep trying!

Hi ladies I had my mirena removed on tues 30th sep 08.Wanted to keep a little diary of my progress for anyone going through the early stages of removal like myself. I did not have much bleeding at all more like very lightspots for maybe 3 days.The first week was painfull cramping and extreme headaches.(much the same as when mirena was still in) Extreme mood swings. Extreme backache.Kept waiting for AF to start as many others have but still show.Week 2 :I was so bloated that honestly you would think i was 4 months preg. I really lived in track pants as that was all that would fit.The pressure in my lower stomach from this was terrible.Still very moody(like when i first quit smoking) very agitated.still no bleeding.Took a HPT but showed a neg. bummer. I was waiting for the CRASH that you hear about and for me it was about day 10 and 11. wow was this horrible. lasted probably 2 days(most of the above mentioned but x10) and then my head was clear like it hasn't been in years.I had mirena in for 2 1/2 years and NEVER had bleeding or spotting from day 1.Week 3 :Visited my doc today, had pap smear,When i had my last visit he said i had signs of "fibroids" (which is also a direct link from mirena's hormones)Fingers crossed they are small with no harm to conceiving.He thinks AF should arrive in the next 2 weeks. So i am playing the waiting game.On a brighter note this week I feel more like my old bubbly self.which is a huge positive.I will update regulary as I am trying to get pregnant like most of us.A big thank you to all ladies who have posted previously I have read all the stories about 5 times. It gives me comfort to know I am not alone.Good luck ladies and baby dust to all.

Hi Ladies,I am new to the post and I want to let you know how helpful everyone's comments have been. Also want to say congrats on the long duration of the forum. Hello again, I posted earlier - I'm the one who had the mirena for 4 years and loved it- best bc method I could imagine.  Had it removed on Feb 9th.  Based on the postings earlier, I was armed with three bags of pads and tampons ready for weeks of horrific bleeding.  Instead, I waited until yesterday, when I finally got my first period in 4 years.  It has been, so far, entirely normal.  No cramping at all (I typically would have bad cramps) and not unusually heavy or chunky at all.  I'm going to wait to have another period next month, hopefully that will also be normal and then ttc in April or May.  Right now, we're just not fooling around and we're fine with that.  We want to wait until things normalize (which everything already appears to be normal) and then start trying.  I do want to say, to gbj819, that I think 1 in 3 pregnancies result in a miscarry.  It's so common, so please do not worry unnecessarily.  If you have several miscarriages, definitely speak with your doctor and see what the issue could be.I'll post again in several months to give an update, or if anything bizarre happens, I'll be sure to note it.  But so far, so good - nothing at all out of the ordinary.

I have the same concerns as you.  I had my Mirena out in August.  I had an irregular period in October (was about 2-3 weeks late, but had negative hpt and blood test).  After that, I became pretty regular (28 days +/- one or two).  We continued ttc.  This month, I was supposed to start on Feb. 18.  Now (45 days later), still haven't started, but have negative hpt and blood tests.  It's very disappointing, but I think I'm just not regular yet.  I thought I would at least be regulated within six months.  I was prepared for it to take a while to concieve, but did not plan on it being so hard to track my cycle in order to concieve.  BTW - I'm about to turn 29 and this is our first time ttc.

I posted earlier in feb.  saying that I was having lots of pain well this is what happened.  I went to see the normal nurse at my ob office who check the IUD it looked normal then but she felt some lumps so she sent me for an ultrasound which came back pretty normal jusy a couple of small cysts.  I was told to come back if I still had pain which i did so I went back.  I saw a specialist this time and he gets me up on the table to check the IUD and he couldn't find it.  Just want I wanted to hear!!!  So he did an ultrasound and it was all in side of me so now I have to have a procedure to have it removed.  The dr. had the nerve to ask me what day I would like to scedual to have it put back in.  AHH no thanks Doc but I will be going back to the pill. Hi, it is normal to have cramping following removal of the mirena.  When I had mine removed I had really bad cramping and bleeding for about 10-12 days.With regards to conceiving after a mirena you really shouldn't be any higher risk for miscarriage at all.  When I had my first mirena removed I conceived within 3 months and had a healthy baby girl - that was 7 years ago now :-)I always think it is sensible to give your body time to adjust to going back to nature and not try and rush things.  Once you've had a couple of natural periods then start your "trying" with gusto, lol.Good luck

Hello all! Had my iud in Oct 05 and had it removed Jan 2 09, no afs at all while having it. Had my first af 3 weeks post removal, i tried to chart from the day i had it removed but i founf the opk strips worked for me. upon using those i found out that i had my ovulation days completly wrong, The egg is only avail for 12 to 24 hrs to be fertilized so the opk are very helpful. i was also told to BD no more then once a day and better off to go every other day.it take sperm 24 hrs to mature again something else i didn't know. I had my IUD removed on February 16th.  Conceived March 25th.  Congratulations me!I enjoyed the mirena the entire time I had it, 2.5 yrs.  I spotted for months after having it inserted, but then had short but regular periods following.I had my mirena removed during my period due to the fact I was told it was the best time because it would ensure I was not pregnant.  I spotted for a couple days after removal, but boy, my period came with a vengence and on time the following month.  It was clotty enough to raise suspicion, but nothing I was too morried about because I knew to expect some changes.There were obviously some changes after insertion and after removal... duh!  This is a hormone, your body will be doing some adjustments.  Energy levels, mood, intensity of period, spotting varies from person to person.  If there is one thing I know now from reading a million blogs is that it's unpredictable for any individual.  Don't fret, nothing is permanent... mirena did not destroy your body.  If you take good care of yourself, your body will work for you.  If you don't take good care of yourself, your body may not adapt to changes well.I planned on having my mirena taken out a few months before trying.  I have seen on more than one site that women would occasionally miscarry because their uterus was not fully prepared after months and years of an IUD (and its hormones) to sustain pregnancy.  I told him (the man)  to be careful or stay away for at least the first two ovulations after removal.THE GOOD NEWS: After playing it safe for a month and a half, I came back from a trip and BAM, we got a little excited... NOW I'M PREGNANT!As the vendor and doctors say, you can get pregnant immediately, so be careful because you should take the precaution of waiting a month or two rather than taking on the risk of miscarriage.Don't be niave either, you potentially could take several cycles to conceive.  There is such a thing as trying, that's why it's called trying... no one can guarantee success on the first, second, third, forth or even tenth try.  Everybody is different and if you're not in a condition to conceive, you won't.  Take immaculate care of yourself pre- and post-mirena removal with exercise and a healthy diet.  And by all means if you're overweight, lose some weight.  Fat cells (generally storage fat cells- adipose and visceral fat) release estrogen which in excess can prevent you from conceiving for several reasons.  Take care of youself and listen to your doctor... in time it will happen.

ohiomama: Maybe yuor body is taking a little longer to adapt. If I were you I would give it one more month and see how your periods are then. I know it's frustrating, and reading all the horror stories don't help, but if you really are concerned see your ob.  I had my first period 2 days after it was removed and  i had some clots as well but normal bleeding, and I figured my body was just cleansing itself.momof5grlz: I have been really tired especially this past weekend, and really hungry. This could be pms symptoms as well, but I am getting anxious to see if my husband and I were successful. Part of me wants to be prego now, but part of me feels that waiting one more month would be better in the long run.  I am due to get aunt flo thurs. so we will see if she is absent. I will keep you posted.I want to give you both some advice. This is something I read. If you are trying to get prego start taking prenatal vitamins asap. Do not quote me on this, but I believe I read it on the mirena website.  Mirena thins the lining of your uterus, but if you take baby asprin it will help to build it back up faster.
